intro: Anomospermum schomburgkii var. lucidum, commonly known as the lucid anomospermum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, trifoliate leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom during the warmer months. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. This plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
